feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 1:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 9:17PM MST until August 23 at 4:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River near Solomon affecting Graham County. .Heavy rain has led to a rapid rises on the Gila River. This update includes new data on a lower measurement in Virden that is expected to drop the crest at the Gila River near Solomon from 21 to 20.5 ft.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 9:06PM MST until August 22 at 9:09PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River at Duncan affecting Greenlee County. .Heavy rain has led to a rapid rises on the Gila River. This update includes new data on a lower measurement in Virden that is expected to drop the crest at the Gila River in Duncan from moderate to minor flood stage.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 21 at 9:05AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA MONDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area on Monday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 21 at 7:56PM HST until August 22 at 6:00PM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST MONDAY FOR SOUTH FACING SHORES OF ALL ISLANDS... .A south-southwest swell (190 degrees) has built larger than expected late this afternoon and evening, leading to advisory level surf for south facing shores. The large surf will continue into Monday afternoon.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 3:50AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG THIS MORNING... Patchy dense fog has formed across central Illinois early this morning. Visibility may fall below one-quarter mile at times in spots, leading to potentially hazardous travel conditions. Be sure to slow down if you encounter fog, use low beam headlights, and leave plenty of distance between you and the vehicle ahead of you.
